11549: Keynote speaker @maurerchr in #morningtalk: #MeritOrder sounded like a "perfidious" order, but it is only a model. The electricity market, which has a bad reputation in political circles, worked, as the securing of supplies to France last winter showed. https://t.co/77UWW2Z8Ol

11552: @AKoppl: The Commission has taken the right path by focusing on investments, but the effect is medium-term. There is still potential in the proposal to increase the benefits for consumers. This also requires strengthening the network infrastructure. #Morgengespraech https://t.co/TuxSy555Jc
11553: CEO Strugl in #morningconversation: The "Contract for Difference" would limit the flexibility of pumped storage power plants with a quasi-fixed price. Such restrictions unsettle investments and thus the mobilization of private capital for the #energytransition

11556: @PeterMolnarEE From the #morningconversation: The market itself worked. The collateral consequences were and are sometimes harsh. Accompanying instruments are included in the Commission's proposal, but only a comprehensive expansion of renewables will really improve things.
11557: CEO Strugl in the #morningconversation on security: A one-year price guarantee, for example, is included in the proposal. The most important building block is sufficient production. If there is a lot of supply on the market, prices fall. That's why the answer is: massive expansion of renewables.

11692: Development of infrastructure for #H2 with the goal: Austria should be integrated into a European H2 market as soon as possible. "Southern corridor" for pipeline-based import is more economically interesting than shipping, says @yooditneyer at #INSPIRE energy talk
11693: In response to @yooditneyer's question about a funding system for #H2: In principle, an action model that will promote competition and should have a long-term effect. The pilot project will start in 2024. #INSPIRE
11694: Bernhard Prinz (AGGM): Electrolysis should be close to the producer, as #H2 can be transported more efficiently than electricity. "The regulator still lacks the regulatory instruments for this in its toolbox." #INSPIRE https://t.co/HCWu0Sw7Dd
11695: Wind and PV industries are becoming natural partners of the #hydrogen economy. Seasonal energy balancing through stored #H2 is necessary, but this does not reduce the pressure on the electricity grid expansion. #INSPIRE
11696: Manuel Beschliesser (COO LAT Nitrogen): Green #H2 is the game changer in the industry. Production and storage are at the heart of the transformation. The request is "planning security" in terms of funding and legal framework conditions. #INSPIRE

11738: Brigitte Bach @AITtomorrow2day presents current research results on the need for flexibility in the electricity sector at #Inspire Energy Talk: The greatest increase in the need for flexibility is in very short-term and seasonal flexibility. https://t.co/aOYxXu7vt9
11739: Good news for hydropower: Climate change is not leading to a decline in production, but rather to a profile shift from summer to winter. In terms of consumption, the need for heat is reduced, but the need for cooling is increasing, says Brigitte Bach @AITtomorrow2day #Inspire
11740: Lack of infrastructure is expensive: @GChristiner ner @apg_at mentions 150 million euros in costs in 2023 just due to a lack of network infrastructure for flexibility. And yet: there is no business case for flexibility products on the electricity market in Austria. #Inspire https://t.co/Qq4LZOJIwC
11741: CEO Michael Strugl: Germany has a concrete, comprehensive strategy to accelerate storage expansion - including the duration of the process. "That's how it has to be done." #Inspire https://t.co/qb3VKP81nH
11742: Brigitte Bach @AITtomorrow2day: We will not be able to avoid large-scale technical solutions, central storage facilities are also needed, specifically: large batteries, hydrogen storage. This requires rapid market integration and market design. #Inspire
11743: According to @GChristiner @apg_at, there is still a lot to do in the distribution network to address the flexibility there (home storage, electric cars). Without this, there is no incentive for private customers to make their infrastructure available. #Inspire
11744: We will need all options because they offer different levels of flexibility. It might have been wiser to push for storage instead of the PV expansion that is already taking place. "I would be in favor of subsidizing storage," says CEO Strugl. #Inspire
11745: CEO Strugl: Pumped storage power plants will continue to be successful in the market in the future when other forms of storage enter the market, because demand will grow with the expansion: from currently 60 GW to 500 GW by 2050 #Inspire
